org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.legacy.hardware.tankdrive

Class Drivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.hardware.Mechanism
      • org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.legacy.hardware.tankdrive.Drivetrain

  • public class Drivetrain
extends Mechanism
    Drivetrain is the class that is used to define all of the hardware for a robot's drivetrain. Drivetrain must be instantiated, then initialized using init() before being used. This class also contains autonomous actions involving the drivetrain. encoderInit() must be called before an autonomous action can be called. This class describes a tank drivetrain.

      • driveToPos

        public void driveToPos(double speed,
                       double leftInches,
                       double rightInches,
                       double timeoutS)
        Drive to a relative position using encoders and an IMU. Robot will stop moving if any of three conditions occur:
        • Move gets to the desired position
        • Move runs out of time
        • Driver stops the running OpMode
        Parameters:
        speed - maximum power of drivetrain motors when driving
        leftInches - number of inches to move on the left side
        rightInches - number of inches to move on the right side
        timeoutS - amount of time before the move should stop

      • driveStraightPID

        public void driveStraightPID(double speed,
                             double correction)
        Drive accurately using a PID loop.
        Parameters:
        speed - speed at which the motor shall turn
        correction - a placeholder value for PID output in case correction isnt given a new value

      • turnPID

        public void turnPID(int angle)
        Turn to a specified angle accurately using a PID loop.
        Parameters:
        angle - number of degrees to turn

      • turn

        public void turn(double angle,

        Turn to a specified angle using an IMU. Robot will stop moving if any of three conditions occur:
        • Move gets to the desired angle
          Move runs out of time
          Driver stops the running OpMode
Parameters:
angle - number of degrees to turn
timeoutS - amount of time before the move should stop

  • rotate

    private void rotate(int degrees,
                    double power)
    Rotate left or right the number of degrees. Does not support turning more than 180 degrees. Starts pid controller. PID controller will monitor the turn angle with respect to the target angle and reduce power as we approach the target angle with a minimum of 20%. This is to prevent the robots momentum from overshooting the turn after we turn off the power. The PID controller reports onTarget() = true when the difference between turn angle and target angle is within 2% of target (tolerance). This helps prevent overshoot. The minimum power is determined by testing and must enough to prevent motor stall and complete the turn. Note: if the gap between the starting power and the stall (minimum) power is small, overshoot may still occur. Overshoot is dependant on the motor and gearing configuration, starting power, weight of the robot and the on target tolerance.
    Parameters:
    degrees - Degrees to turn, + is left - is right
